website_summaries.verdict: This spray cleanser not only cleans, but prevents dust and dirt from sticking to the surface of interiors.
pros: Achieve a noticeable removal of dirt and residue on your boat's interior as well as several types of surfaces
Engineered for boats that operate in harsh conditions with customers reporting successful results in terms of maintenance
cons: May require reapplication on a regular basis

customer_reviews.title: Great, but confusing marketing
customer_reviews.text: I have been using A303 protectant on vinyl, rubber and leather for a decade due to its ease of application and far less out-gassing during summer months. It also has a semigloss/matte finish that I prefer. My main comment has to do with their marketing... The best I can tell, the same product is marketed for various applications. I have read that the Marine protectant is the same 303 I have been using as their Automotive product. No big deal once understood, but confusing to the average consumer in the process. PROS Easy application Protects vinyl, rubber, leather Minimal out-gassing Matte finish CONS Confusing marketing plan
customer_reviews.author: Jim Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: NOTE: DOES NOT come with trigger sprayer.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, just be careful, this product DOES NOT come with a trigger sprayer pictured. If you don't have an extra, you may want to search for another version of this product with the trigger sprayer.
customer_reviews.author: Dan J

customer_reviews.title: Works great .. but doesn't last much!
customer_reviews.text: The Product works great! The only down side is that technically (according to the label ) you need to apply it every 3 weeks for the best protection. But I really think it makes a difference... it not only protect but make everything look like new. I applied on almost everything in my yard (only on the plastic and rubber stuff). And made my car plastic parts look like new. Here in Arizona we have a lot of wear on rubber and plastics parts due to amount of sunny days. This sure helps... If you are gonna order... you want a bigger bottle... this didn't last that long! :)
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Be careful using this product!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to protect the vinyl on my boat. My vinyl upholstery is primarily white but also has some marine blue. I tested first. No problem applying. Spot tested on the blue and seemed fine. No blue on white cloth. Didn’t spray on directly. Sprayed on a microfiber cloth and wiped on, then dried thoroughly. Couple of days later I notice three areas where my white cushions are stained with blue streaks. Nothing will get it off. I do feel like I followed the instructions as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Wilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Not what It's cracked up to be
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of what you read about this product it dose not work on stuff exposed to water. It washes off. I did a propane tank cover with it on an RV. Looked great after I did it. it rained the next night and it now looks like I never did it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rohrbaugh

customer_reviews.title: If it Works...
customer_reviews.text: If this stuff works as advertised I will be VERY happy with it. Don't know yet. Just put it on today. It took about 1/2 hour to apply on an 8 x 8 cover. I used a big spa brush. I have been told countless time NOT to use Armor All on a spa cover. So, this. It required about 1/3 of the bottle. The questions are, will it actually protect from UV rays, and will it last for 6 weeks? We'll see. But it actually makes the cover look GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical how well this would work but so far I am impressed. As you can see in the photo, it made the vinyl sides of my old faded hot tub look like new. I did the cover also but it was newer and not as noticeable a difference. I wish I had done a side by side comparison with similar products but too late now. It’s only been on a week so I can’t rate it’s longevity. It is a little expensive but I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: fyrefiter

customer_reviews.title: 303 is the only product I use.
customer_reviews.text: I use 303 products in my car and in my boats. On my pontoon boat, I pick a sunny day and let the seats get hot so the Vinyl seat fabric expands. That helps the 303 get down into the pools of the vinyl and I spray 303 protectant on liberally and wipe it in leaving them very damp to dry in the sun. I do this several times a summer and before I put it away for winter here in Michigan. Best product on the market. No alcohol in it like other brands that actually do more harm than good.
customer_reviews.author: sbcoach

customer_reviews.title: Does as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was wishing for something that was different from the same old Armor all from years ago but seems they keep bottling in in different packages and calling it something else. Yes it does enhance plastics and rubber but don't get it wet! good for a detail when heading to a car show or something like that. That's my opinion anyway
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works
customer_reviews.text: Nearly 20 years ago, when we purchased a pop-top camper with rubberized sides, and we treated it with this product. There was a bit left in the bottle, so I saved it. When we recently did a thorough cleaning and revamp of the camper, I ordered another bottle. People often are surprised to hear how old our camper is. We do clean it and take care of it, but this product has kept the material from cracking all these years. We use the camper a lot. We are now considering using this product, on our inflatable boat and other items.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not for fabrics
customer_reviews.text: The word « buffing” should have alerted me that this could not be used on fabric. Although the description on the product itself clearly states that fact this ought to be plainly stated in the listing. I cannot Address its intended usefulness because I had no other use for it. Return shipping would be too expensive to bother with. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply, no harsh odor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 303 (30306) Aerospace Protectant, UV Protectant for Boats and Patio Furniture to sun proof the Lifetime Deck Boxes I purchased. I am also using it on my plastic wicker lawn furniture and anything else I come across that I plan on keeping outside. I live in South Texas and the sun is very harsh on items left outside. It was easy to use; I sprayed a small amount directly on the top of the deck boxes and then took a rag and rubbed it into the plastic. For the sides of the boxes I spray directly onto the rag and rubbed the sides. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Alain Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Restored My Sun-Faded Vehicle Trim
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying every automotive product made to restore the sun-faded black plastic trim on my truck's exterior over the past two years and finally found this. I originally bought this to treat my outdoor furniture and that all looks brand new, but I can't get over how great my truck looks now. I didn't even follow the directions, I just sprayed it on and wiped it off.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Roseland

customer_reviews.title: Long term benefit
customer_reviews.text: I got this brand because it’s was suggested for protecting the plastic parts on my Honda Element. Over time the exterior plastic pieces started to take on a dull, dried out appearance. At first the 303 produced seemed to be as effective as the other stuff I was using. But after one bottle the plastic parts no longer had the dull, dried out appearance, even after being wash off during car washes and long periods of not being applied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Where Have You Been All This Time?! This Is the Right Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Saw a lot of excellent, raving reviews so I ordered some to try. They were correct! It applies easily and evenly. Non sticky, non greasy and dries quickly. You can apply it and buff it off for a smooth matte sheen finish. Or you can apply it wet and let dry for a slightly shinier gloss. Either way, there is no greasy or sticky feeling. No oily residue on your hands either. Looks like new, fresh rubber or vinyl when you are done. My 1995 OBS F-150 never looked better! I am sold on this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I make custom burlap wreaths. I purchased this uv Protection to spray on the fabric. A couple days after my wreath hung in the evening sun the colors faded.
customer_reviews.author: ClearlyCanadian

customer_reviews.title: Great auto interior protection!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff for automotive interior plastic protection. I love that its not too glossy or greasy. Been using this exclusively since I discovered it many years ago. All my plastic and weather stripping gets this stuff a few times a year. One of the benefits is I don't need to treat my dash every time I detail. Just a quick wipe is all it takes . I do apply kinda heavy for the first couple applications before everything stays nice and evenly protected.
customer_reviews.author: JoulesWinfield

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: I've used numerous products over the years, including having a small weekend detailing business. This product is by far the best interior protectant I've used. The results are outstanding and the sheen left behind is precisely the cleaned conditioned look I like after a interior detail. I prefer a low sheen and this is the product that does it with superior protection. Great for the Florida sun.
customer_reviews.author: Scrub175

customer_reviews.title: Very good w/o greasy buildup attracting dirt
customer_reviews.text: To me 1 of biggest differences b/tn this and Armour All is that AA is much more greasy, which I hadn't thought was an issue but it IS. When I looked around at experts talking about preservation cleaning accumulated dirt 1st is a big deal. Then looked at AA treated things and saw how it was really attracting dirt. Much more than you want as it'd make it to where you should clean it every time before retreating. This stuff treats things very well w/o the greasy dirt buildup. Very good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: William McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product from a family referral. I had limited expectations after buying a boat that had seats that seemed dried out and ready to crack. I just wanted to save what I could. After one application, I'm really happy with how soft my seats are and how much life has been brought back into them. I don't have to worry about how people use the seats for fear of tearing them
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A Laplante

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is wonderful. We live in Colorado, in intense sun which quickly fades just about anything. This stuff brought plastic and even aluminum back to life after trying numerous other products to no avail. This thing has saved us hundreds of dollars replacing products that we thought were shot when, in fact, they were revived in no time with 303 Protectant. Buy this product, and save a lot of money..
customer_reviews.author: M Bulldawg

customer_reviews.title: I imagine it's working
customer_reviews.text: I bought to put on the surfaces of my inflatable kayaks. The liquid sprayed on easily and dried relatively quickly. It is VERY SLIPPERY so I'm glad I put newspaper down on the floor of the garage where I sprayed it. The slight oversprayed made for hazardous conditions. The surface darkened a little, which I kinda of like as it had bleached out a little. I have not way of knowing if it's working. Will have to wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: S. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Did not live up to its reviews. Used as directed, faded right back again after a few days. Armor All is better. Reviews on web lead me to believe this would bring faded car plastics back to life. It did, for a few days only. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: What is this sorcery.
customer_reviews.text: What the... I used it on my car to. Its shocking. What the f...... WHAT IS THIS!? My car is a 2014 CRV, very well looked after but i live in the desert and hard water... It fades the plastic parts on cars much faster. And this made the plastic look BRAND. FREAKEN. NEW. Even after WEEKS... IT STILL LOOKS NEW!? Dont you dare stop making this because i need it forever and ever.
customer_reviews.author: BurritoBrothers

customer_reviews.title: Great for Bouncy Houses!
customer_reviews.text: I used this at the beginning of the summer on a used bouncy house we were able to get off of Facebook Marketplace. I was concerned that the vinyl material would begin to wear with sun and frequent use, so I applied this spray with a rag to all surfaces exposed to frequent sun or children. It has lasted us through the year great so far, and I'm hoping will still be in good shape when we get it out next Spring!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Moon

customer_reviews.title: Never get Armor All again...303 is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This is the product you want for your interior. It makes plastics and leathers look better than new! And for the tires, its NOT the thing for getting a wet look, but what it does is helps to keep the rubber soft, making tires (or fanbelts, hoses, axle dust covers, bushings, etc....) last longer. Just spray all the tires and let sit overnight and repeat every couple months. 303 puts all other products to shame...truly!
customer_reviews.author: Jack12

customer_reviews.title: Best vinyl protectant money can buy!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2009 pontoon boat that had been protected by this product for the last 7 years. This is our 5th pontoon boat over the last 30 years and this one look like the day we bought it. I cannot say enough about this product. The vinyl seats really look great with no cracking and no chalking. We leave them exposed to the sun most of the summer and it is a testament to this product the boat looks so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Protects kayak
customer_reviews.text: I used on a polyethylene kayak that was given to me. It restored the luster to the finish without being shiny. I used it on all the surfaces. The black seats looked dry and discolored before use.....and like new after. The sliding surfaces.....seat adjustments, rudder cables, also moved more smoothly after application. Easy on, easy off. No bad odor.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Superior product, outperforms other protectorants
customer_reviews.text: What can I say other than this product is the best. I use it on my 2011 Jeep's hardtop, interior and exterior plastic trim and after 9 years it still looks new. Unlike other protectorants this one works and lasts for months. It costs a little more but its worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Really for marine use?
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my car and it didn't last at all once we had a good rain which makes me wonder how well it would really work for boats.. with all the high praise was definitely expecting more from this one.. also doesn't seem to protect rubber much at all.. all the rubber seals I sprayed it on are back to how they looked before(slightly faded black)
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought is would be
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with product. The product has a satisfaction guarantee, but the seller (Less is Always More) does not honor it. The issue is with the seller. Read the fine print on fees and shipping if you return item.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Anne

customer_reviews.title: Did not work!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on my outdoor patio mat. Bought a large red patio mat. Followed the instructions as it says to wipe down after spraying. My nice red patio mat turned pink within a few days in the sun. Very disappointed. I guess it doesn't work on patio mats.
customer_reviews.author: C Roth

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for a several years. I can say it works. Several kayaks in the Florida sun still look almost new compared to friends without protection. Just follow the instructions and apply as often as necessary. Pointless to purchase and not use regularly. I have used it on several vehicles plastics and the same great protection.
customer_reviews.author: AZRC51

customer_reviews.title: Very Toxic!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this stuff works great, but don't use it unless you wear a respirator, full googles, and full skin protection (like a waterproof or tyvek suit). I used this on the inside of my camper to remove mildew stains with just sunglasses on to protect from a direct hit in the eyes. Within 10 minutes, the fumes caused my nasal passages, lungs, tongue and hands to burn. I almost passed out! Next time, I'm going for something less toxic.
customer_reviews.author: CJG

customer_reviews.title: dare to compare with Armor-all
customer_reviews.text: I have a new never used 3.5 Tahotsu outboard. Sprayed it down with armor-all. I then applied this Aerospace Protectant to a small area already sprayed with Armor-all. A very noticeable clear shine with the Aerospace. Armor-all appears to leave a dull looking residue. You get what you pay form in this case!!
customer_reviews.author: Everglades

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this on the vinyl flap of my heavy-duty pet door. Had to replace the old one when the vinyl began to split. I've used it on the new door for a while, now, and it looks good. Still, it may take a year or two for any difference to really be seen - but 32 ounces should easily last that long for a single door. It is easy to apply - I clean the door each month, then spray some on the top of the door and wipe it along the rest with a cloth, being sure I get into the side expansion grooves. Inside and out. Doesn't take but a minute.
customer_reviews.author: blueskys

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Amazing results on Patio Furniture
customer_reviews.text: Our patio furniture made of aluminum (Castelle) had a white film over it which would not come out with anything. Major sun damage. I was convinced it was beyond repair. After reading many great reviews, I ordered both the 303 cleaner and protectant. With the cleaner the white stains remained but it did do a nice job of cleaning. I then used the protectant and boy am I impressed! Restored the original color and looks amazing. Incredible results! I will be using this going forward. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PClaro

customer_reviews.title: 303 Marine and Recreation Aerospace Protectant
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 1994 Winnebago Brace 34' Motor Home with Amazing Results 3 years ago!!! I covered the Motor Home, Tires and All Covers on roof !!! No more Sun Damage on anything!!! AMAZING!!! I'm ordering more just because I don't want to press mu luck !!! I haven't needed to use more for 3 years!!!
customer_reviews.author: James D. Dorman

customer_reviews.title: My go to product for protecting the interior of my vehicles
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to surface protectant and has never failed to satisfy. I use this on all my vehicles and has never let me down. This product will not off-gas as bad as the armor all and others. In intense sunlight it will leave a slight haze on the inside of your windshield but not nearly as bad as the better known brands.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E

customer_reviews.title: Makes kayak slippery
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 inflatable kayaks. Everyone says to use this, so I tried it on one. It made the PVC tubes slick, and things don't stick to them unless you clean the 303 off with alchohol. Not a major problem, but also makes my 10' kayak harder to carry. I have not used it on my bigger kayak....I like to put lettering and stickers on my big whitewater, and I can't do that on my smaller one, they come right off. Probably good for the kayak, but I prefer to not use it on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: I use this on motorhome tires to eliminate drying and cracking.
customer_reviews.text: Had a motorhome and this was the only stuff that should be used on tires according to the nations largest RV dealer which has a branch here in Florida. This soaks in and replenishes the oils, etc. Some tire dressings end up drying the rubber and actually shorten the life of the tire. I use this everywhere the other protectants are used. Wipe it off until item is dry and a you get a nice dry look that does not attract dust and dirt. You do not get the "cheesy" wet look!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Renewed the bumpers on my SUV
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Arizona desert and even though my vehicles are in the garage the heat sucks the life out of everything. My SUV's bumpers/trim were looking faded so I purchased this item based on the reviews. Applied the product and looks almost like new again. I applied it to the interior and exterior of my new Subaru and also applied it to my boat. Good stuff
customer_reviews.author: GenXer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Interior Dressing
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this product is amazing in every way it keeps my plastics looking good inside my car and I've been using it for quite some time now had to buy the bigger bottle because I use it for all my vehicles great product and I recommend it to anyone, neat freaks and detailers alike
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Govea-Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Was turned onto this by our uncle. it provides shine to our jet skis after a long day on the water. also amazing for detailing. if we leave out skis in the water then we just douse it at the end of the day and when we come out in the morning it looks like it hasn't even hit the water yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany stedman

customer_reviews.title: This is the product to use on anything vinyl exposed to the sun
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product all my life on anything vinyl which is exposed to the sun. The tonneau cover on my pickup truck looks great after 6 years of southern sun exposure. I would highly recommend this for protecting vinyl anything, that is outdoors, exposed to the elements, especially the sun.
customer_reviews.author: musicman

customer_reviews.title: the shine
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to be pretty good I just started using it it definitely got my vinyl top looking the way it looked when I first got it but then at the same time my vinyl top is new but it's shining looks like it's protecting I hope it does good it's winter right now so I guess I'll really see how it works in the summer come
customer_reviews.author: richard watts

customer_reviews.title: Been Using For Years
customer_reviews.text: Have used 303 for decades as it is far superior to other protectants when it comes to UV protection. Been great for all plastic parts, vinyl interiors and three generations of Jeep Soft tops and Hardtops. Unfortunately its hard to find locally except at boating or RV supply stories so easier to get on Amazon now.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I used 1/2 a bottle on my two and single car garage doors to protect them against the sun and provide a much needed renewed luster, as they had lost their luster in the sun over the past 10 years. This product has withstood countless storms and still makes my doors appear brand new. I love it, i also use this on my cars

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: Use this product on a fleet of boats I have. Nomally, I buy this but the gallon. Opted to get the 32 oz size this time to have a distribution container that delivered an evenly-distributed mist on application. With this particular order though, the spray pattern is disrupted and is remarkaly uneven and heavy. I waste product this way. PS - I would love to get a replacement nozzle head. Bill Webb
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 303 provides UV protection for many serfacies
customer_reviews.text: I use 303 on my RV tires and wiper blades (does not contain petroleum distillates. I also use it on the clear plastic coating that was applied to the front of my rig. On the roof I apply to all the vents, and other plastic items such as the satellite cover and the A/C covers.
customer_reviews.author: Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Protection of plastics
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on my kayak and dash of my truck. The difference it makes can be seen once applied. I put it on one of my old kayak and it brought back a little of the color, shined it nice, but it also protects it from sun damage. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed. Useless on my stiff vinyl boat seats.
customer_reviews.text: Read alot that this is the stuff. My boat I just bought had vinyl seats and the vinyl was kinda stiff. I hoped this would soften it up. It didn't do anything. I even soaked it and let it sit. So not much better than armoral or any other spray that I could tell. The overspray did make my boat floor super slippery though. So watch for that.
customer_reviews.author: Noone

customer_reviews.title: Works good on electronic cymbals
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to restore the natural beauty of my Roland electronic drum cymbals, and it works. I recommend you wear gloves to apply this, and keep it off your hands, just to be safe. I used a microfiber towel to apply which seemed to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Spade

customer_reviews.title: Used before and liked well enought to purchase more.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product for use in my car on the dash and door panels. Leaves a nice clean appearance without leaving an oiley residue. Gives a nice gloss without a high reflective shine. Also use it on the rubber door seals and on the dark panels on the outside of the vehicle. Will continue to use this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband, he used it for the inside and outside of our motorhome. When I asked him if he was happy with the purchase, he asked me to buy more! I don't think there is any higher compliment or better recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Heather McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Drop top looks new!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing stuff! Used on my 2006 mustang since new. You’d think it had just been replaced (convertible top) everything black looks like the day I bought the car new. Greatest stuff ever!!!! Spread it around, wait a couple of minutes and towel off. The best....
customer_reviews.author: steve l. childers

customer_reviews.title: Great product...works on just about everything.
customer_reviews.text: I have been really impressed by this product. I use this on almost all the non-metal parts of my car (and wife’s car). The only thing I change is the rag I use. Tires, seats, dash, exterior plastic... it works on just about everything. I imagine this would even work on my cars paint but I’ll keep using wax for now.
customer_reviews.author: PRR

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for a several seasons and it has had little effect on keeping out hot tub cover pliable. Couple of days after using on new cover it seems to dry out rather quickly. Front half of cover has faded differently that the back half. Both are in direct sunlight most of the day. I wold not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: barneye

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a couple days
customer_reviews.text: Works Great as soon as you apply it Then the next day fades back to what I started with Applied several times Same Results ????
customer_reviews.author: mike mcvey

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down this is the best product of it's kind that I've tried. Armor All in the 70s-80s, Meguir's in the 90s-2000s, now this. Easy on and off and it works better than anything I've tried. I would use it on my face if the label said so. Great product and very durable. Pricey, but definitely worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: TexStan

customer_reviews.title: not noticing the protection like people say it does
customer_reviews.text: I watched the detail geek and he love this product. I used it a few times and find it is not that easy to apply and it doesn't last long between washes. Jay leno's products are better if you ask me.
customer_reviews.author: SugarPlum

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Very good product! I like that it dries in a nice matt finish, and not greasy and oily. Just spray it on, and wipe it with a Terry cloth. Cleans and protects! Very pleased and I will be sticking with this product!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca groppi

customer_reviews.title: It's decent enough.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on my RVs decals. Not so good on hard plastic. Shines plastic for a day or two then you can't tell a difference. Does do good beading water off my RV walls.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas D.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for our boat..... Found out it's great for detailing cars.... This stuff is amazing! That's really all I can say. You don't know until you try it yourself. Revitalizes plastic trim on your car or truck's exterior. Shines your interior for weeks unlike other products.
customer_reviews.author: David and Chrystal

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but it works...
customer_reviews.text: Used it to restore water repellancy to camper vinyl "canvas". Restored lightly worn finish/shine on pop-up camper tents and awning. Follow directions. No leaks anymore. Very satisfied. This stuff is pricey everywhere, but it does what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K.

customer_reviews.title: Must have item for kayaks!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff gave my old kayaks that new shine again and after a week, both kayaks still shows signs of the application. Best of all, it does not leave an overly oily feel or no odd chemical smells.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Worth The $$$
customer_reviews.text: I have been satisfied with 303 Aerospace Protectant for years... they deliver great protection and longevity. Spray the product on the surface. It will wet the surface. Leave it for about an hour and buff lightly. Awesome look and excellent UV protection.
customer_reviews.author: JL in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best for boat seats
customer_reviews.text: The BEST thing to keep your boat seats supple and crack/stain free for many years. Not cheap, but you get what ya pay for, right? Been using this for years with excellent results.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stoffel

customer_reviews.title: Best protectant out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to protectant for my vehicles, never greasy and dries to a nice mat finish. This product is worth every penny. I use it on all vinyl and plastics in my vehicle and also on my leather seats. I also use this on the black plastic parts outside the vehicle, Black trim, wipers, the cowling between the windshield and engine. Provides ultimate UV protection. Outside of a good All Purpose Cleaner 303 is the second most important product to detail my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Marlow L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my car
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my Engines and Interior Plastics. I still use Armor all for Rubber seals. Best to Clean the surfaces first. Seems to last with little shine. I live up North so Im not sure what the Southern Sun ex-poser would do
customer_reviews.author: Ftec

customer_reviews.title: Makes plastic slippery.
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. Holds colors on plastic and vinyl. Very slippery when applied. Will slip down in vinyl chair after application for a couple months. Tried on kayak paddle, too slippery grip. Disc golf plastic discs, absolutely horrendous slipping. Lasted to some degree for three months. Can't be wiped off. Limits use of product on most handled items significantly.
customer_reviews.author: WayneChicagoTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best. Product. Ever. I used their cleaner prior to using this protectant on my Lazboy resin patio furniture. I was nervous, as the furniture was pretty pricey. But the color was starting to get dull. Looks brand new now! I am amazed! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: rynotank

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Follow the instructions, apply and then wipe it down with a dry cloth. Leaving it "wet" may cause streaking after the first rain. I did the interior and exterior rubber and plastic on an 11 year old pickup with 303 and it looks new again. 303 brings back the new color to rubber and plastic with a slight sheen... not the high gloss wet look most protectants leave. While it's initially not as cheap as some big box store protectants, a little goes a long way so the end cost per application is probably cheaper. If it protects half as good as other reviewers say I'll be a lifetime user.
customer_reviews.author: milwiron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply definitely will update about sun protection
customer_reviews.text: Due to the fact we just purchased this product we can’t give an opinion about the sun protection but it’s easily applied the smell is in bad little pricey but would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Donnarose

customer_reviews.title: 303 Products Protect Things Well in Arizona!
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of reviews other places and by people with boats and RVs, I started trying 303 products. They are superior for keeping things from deteriorating in the sun. I live in Arizona, where the sun is absolutely brutal on anything kept outside. I use 303 products to keep my stuff lasting far longer than it would normally. I can't speculate on how long it keeps things going, because some things I still have outside after almost 10 years, and they are still holding up. If not for the 303, I would suspect I'd get 3 to 4 years tops, before they are falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Tman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Spray Pump! Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, Love the product. At this price though you would think they could put it in a decent sprayer. Every time I pump it leaks more out of the pump than it sprays.
customer_reviews.author: rjgilly

customer_reviews.title: Quick drying, hope it saves our boat seats!
customer_reviews.text: Just got a new pontoon boat and I've seen what the Carolina sun can do to boat seats! Bought this before we even brought the boat home. I use it on the seats every other week. It dries really fast..guess time will tell if it helps!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it to spray on my pop-up camper canvas. It's water-proof again. Then tried it on the black plastic trim on my Jeep. Works great on both applications. Minus the previous scratches from mishaps in the plastic, the fender flares look brand new. You need to apply it about every 4 weeks, but hey, they look great and I think any other product is going to do the same. Works well on my interior as well.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Boat Magic!
customer_reviews.text: The stuff is magic!!! I am a repeat customer of this product - but it’s great on the leather / topside fiberglass of my boat. Been using it for years and will continue
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Rose

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! Where has this been the last four years of my boat ownership. My 22 year old vinyl has come to a shine of life I shad not been able to accomplish until this. I love it. You can see the protection. What a great find.
customer_reviews.author: T. Arns

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had know about this 2 years ago, would have saved me from replacing $550.00 spa cover. Dust, dirt and grime will destroy your spa cover. The stuff seals all that crud out. Takes only minutes every month or so. A MUST HAVE in Arizona if your spa is outside.
customer_reviews.author: TonyT in AZ

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is a must have, It brings out the richness in everything lol, My tires, windshield wiper blades.. Everything!!.. I Will make sure i keep a bottle of this at home at all times..
customer_reviews.author: Jdubb0113

customer_reviews.title: Smell and greasy
customer_reviews.text: If over applied it is greasy and you will need to buff with dry cloth. Little goes a long way with this stuff. Smelled like vinyl conditioner despite advertising, may have needed shaken well.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: Restored truck bed liner
customer_reviews.text: The before and after pics tell the story. The third photo shows treated vs untreated. Made a four year old bed liner look new with about an hour’s work (not including dry time after washing). Cleaned the bed with a 10:1 mix of simple green and a stiff scrub brush. Let dry. Sprayed on the 303 and immediately wiped down with a microfiber cloth. It’s easier if you spray it on more liberally than the label suggests, but the textured surface of the bed liner will shred the microfiber cloth if you don’t.
customer_reviews.author: Denali owner

customer_reviews.title: best buy EVER
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my TONNEAU COVER on my truck and on my boat seats works amazing with no greasy residue you don't slide around like other product and hold it shine for a while with heavy sunlight i will and have buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kirker

customer_reviews.title: Magic
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff, it brought back the color on my plastic trim. It works well on tires, it's not super shiny like some protectors and isn't sticky when dried both of which I like better.
customer_reviews.author: The Yellowdog

customer_reviews.title: Last a long time, excellent protectant
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly recommended product to use on marine upholstery, use once every couple months to keep nice shine and protect my vinyl from harsh SWFL sunshine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W.

customer_reviews.title: Better than most protectants
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and adds a finish to the pontoon seats that resists bird dropping. Not sure how well it will hold up, how easily it will clean up, or how often I have to reapply so longevity remains a question.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 303 protectant for years. It's hard to tell when a product actually works, but all I can say is my sailboat's eisenglass is about 5 years old now and still looks brand new. I've never covered the eisenglass and only take it down during hurricanes, but it goes right back up afterwards. I've used the 303 protectant since the eisenglass was new. I've seen other eisenglass yellow after 2-3 years in the Florida sun when the owner has used nothing, but I am proud to say mine looks fantastic. I also use the 303 on my motorcycle seats, since they see a lot of sun as well. Great product that I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best in class. Forget Armor All. Perfect sheen and protectant. Rejuvenated my windshield wipers too by leaving overnight. Great on dashboard doors seats. Anything black or plastic or vinyl or rubber. Great on my boat. Seats are 10 years old and look new. Amazing..
customer_reviews.author: Sweengolly

customer_reviews.title: Use along with 303 multi surface cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love 303 products! Are use them on our pontoon, paddle board, paddle boat and kayaks. Works great on hot tub cover too. Along with 303 multi surface cleaner, aerospace protectant get all are toys clean and protected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to detail the interior of my boat. I will never use anything but. Brings a subtle shine and you don't have to use much to cover a large space.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Longshore

customer_reviews.title: Good boat seat protectant
customer_reviews.text: I use this after I clean our boat seats and it provides a good protection. I have used this for years and am satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: the Best
customer_reviews.text: My Boats and vehicles sit in harsh sun rays during the summer months and this product keeps them safe. I used Armorall on our dingy one year because I ran out of 303 and that was the only boat that I was repairing and replacing vinyl on the next year.
customer_reviews.author: JHo

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I started using this on my boat seats to preserve them, works great, boat is 8 yrs old and seats look like new. I treat them about every 2 months, spray on, wipe with a cloth and then buff. Works on all kinds of plastic, vinyl, rubber, etc. I now use on vehicle door seals and any thing rubber or vinyl. A product that really works. I bought their fabric conditioner and it water proofs stuff great.
customer_reviews.author: Impatient

customer_reviews.title: Looks like Armor-All, but works MUCH better.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 303 purchase from Amazon. I was very skeptical at first, as the liquid is very similar in appearance to the much cheaper Armor-All. But, I assure you, it is very different: 1. When directions are followed, there is no greasy feel to this product. 2. It makes tires, vinyl etc look NEW, NOT shiny and wet. I hate the used car dealer look of armor-all shine on tires. This leaves a nice satin finish. 3. This lasts a LONG time. Some of the tires I have treated still repel dirt and water after 6 months. Every armor-all treatment I have ever tried tends to wash off in the first real rain storm.
customer_reviews.author: David Conover

customer_reviews.title: It really works.
customer_reviews.text: We use our pontoon boat in salt water area. Been using this product on our pontoon seats since they were new in 2004. 15 years now and the seats look brand new. Not oily like competitive brands and really works if used on a regular basis and as directed. Make sure your seats are clean and rinsed free of any cleaner with clean water. Then apply this product. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Have used this for several years on my pontoon.
customer_reviews.text: Love the way it protects marine vinyl seats.Does not crack or fade.Follow directions on the container!!
customer_reviews.author: F.Dudly

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.
customer_reviews.text: I got it today and went right out and put it on my Tonneau cover on my Pickup. It was only 35 degrees outside but it went on surprisingly easy and didn't leave that greasy film like Armor All and the other protectants do. I am anxious to get inside the truck and give the dash and other trim pieces a good coating. Probably will wait until next spring to hit the exterior vinyl and plastic. So far so good and if it protectect from the UV rays, then it will be all I hoped for. Although I really haven't fully evaluated the product yet, I give it 5/5 since it is all I hoped for up to this point.
customer_reviews.author: Esox07

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Really shined my kayak up nice. Not sure how much UV protection it provides but i will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Little

product_meta.title: 303 Products 30306 Marine & Recreation Aerospace Protectant - 32 oz.
product_meta.description: Size:32 Fl. oz.No other product provides this much protection for your boat and water gear. Use Aerospace Protectant to keep your boat’s seats, sails, hull and windows colorful and clean. Marine Aerospace Protectant is a premium protectant designed to safeguard boats and boat equipment against the damaging effects of daily exposure to UV rays. It’s safe for use on outdoor gear and apparel, too.
feature_bullets: Powerful UV blockers prevent fading, cracking and premature aging
Dries to a clear matte finish
Easy to use: Simply spray on and wipe dry
Safe and effective for: vinyl, Plexiglas, carbon fiber, rubber, plastics and finished leather

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,566 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
